item.title: Fixer Upper + City Tour
item.description: Waco has some great sights from TV shows, but if you don't know the area well you could miss out on finding some of them. This Waco Sites and TV Highlights Tour takes you to areas filmed on shows like Fixer Upper, Wood Work, and others. Plus, you'll also see areas like East Waco and Cameron Park, and pop into neighborhoods worth seeing up close.

image.alt: Fixer Upper + City Tour

item.title: Best of Austin Small-Group Driving Tour with Local Guide
item.description: Get a comprehensive overview of Austin on this sightseeing tour. See famous landmarks along with hidden gems, real neighborhoods, and food trucks. Learn about Austin's history and culture with commentary from your guide and hear fun facts about the city that even the locals don't know. Plus, choose a morning or afternoon departure to easily fit this tour into your schedule.

image.alt: Best of Austin Small-Group Driving Tour with Local Guide

item.title: JFK Assassination and Museum Tour with Lee Harvey Oswald Rooming House
item.description: Somewhere at the intersection of presidential history and American mythology, the JFK assassination continues to fascinate Dallas visitors. See the site where the infamous shooting occurred on this special historical tour to Grassy Knoll and the Kennedy Memorial; separate the facts from the theories with the help of your guide, who will walk you through that day and its aftermath. This tour includes a guide, entrance fees, and round trip transportation.

image.alt: JFK Assassination and Museum Tour with Lee Harvey Oswald Rooming House

item.title: Top Waco Fixer Upper/City Tour: 5 Star, Award Winning, Affordable
item.description: Attention home improvement fans—this tour is for you. With a local guide, explore some of the neighborhoods, houses, shops, landmarks, and structures featured on the HGTV show “Fixer Upper” with Chip and Joanna Gaines. Start in the former Harp Design shop and then explore other spots featured on the show. Plus, water is provided to keep you comfortable as you go.

image.alt: Top Waco Fixer Upper/City Tour: 5 Star, Award Winning, Affordable

item.title: Sunset Dolphin Watch Tour
item.description: Venture out into the Gulf of Mexico and enjoy a relaxing dolphin-watching tour from South Padre Island. Take a seat on the spacious vessel and keep your eyes peeled for pods of Atlantic bottlenose dolphins in their natural habitat. See the playful aquatic creatures swim alongside your boat and take in the scenery of the Texas coast while you sail.

image.alt: Sunset Dolphin Watch Tour

item.title: Austin Biker Gang E-Bike Tour
item.description: Come join this Austin e-bike biker gang to see the sights and feels the vibes of the crown jewel of Hill County. The e-bikes are fun, easy to ride and best with friends to get around this amazing city. Ride past Austin and Hill County icons including The Driskill (a historic and haunted hotel), Austin City Limits, Town Lake, and much more. Enjoy a dynamic experience in a vibrant city where every ride is different.

image.alt: Austin Biker Gang E-Bike Tour

item.title: Eco and Dolphin Watch Tour of South Padre Island
item.description: Watch for the Atlantic bottlenose dolphins that thrive along the coast of South Padre Island on a 1.5-hour wildlife boat tour from Sea Ranch Marina. Cruise past the U.S. Coast Guard Station and Boca Chica Beach, with a comfortable seat on a wildlife-watching boat that’s equipped with a wildlife-safe viewing net so you can see South Padre sea life up close.

image.alt: Eco and Dolphin Watch Tour of South Padre Island

item.title: Baywatch Dolphin Tour
item.description: This Galveston Baywatch Dolphin Tour is a great way to see dolphins on the water in just a few hours. Meet your group and captain at Pier 21 and join the boat you’re assigned for this experience. Then, take off on the water to enjoy some time searching for dolphins in their natural habitat.

image.alt: Baywatch Dolphin Tour

item.title: Historic Galveston Ghost Tour
item.description: Discover the darker side of Galveston on a ghost tour. Pass by mansions and other historical sights where spooky and mysterious things are said to have happened, and hear about the island's secrets, paranormal events, and haunted history that dates back 150 years. This tour is a fun way to learn a bit about Galveston's history.

image.alt: Historic Galveston Ghost Tour

item.title: Austin and Hill Country Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Want to see the best of Austin and the Hill County in the comfort of an air-conditioned Mercedes-Benz sprinter van with a local guide? Look no further! In 90 minutes, this signature tour covers 30 miles and 50+ points of interest, including the Texas Capitol and East Austin’s Six Square District, to give you a taste of the city’s rich culture and history. For even more exploration (with stops), check out the 2.5-hour version of this tour. Route subject to changes or substitutions.

image.alt: Austin and Hill Country Sightseeing Tour

item.title: San Antonio Missions UNESCO World Heritage Sites Tour
item.description: The San Antonio Missions are a UNESCO World Heritage Site you won’t want to miss, filled with history and religious importance. Get the full story on the area that consists of five missions close together from a guide who knows the area and its past well. You’ll see four out of the five missions of the site, as well as La Villita Historic Arts Village, Alamo Plaza, and the Espada Aqueduct.

image.alt: San Antonio Missions UNESCO World Heritage Sites Tour

item.title: From Austin: Hill Country BBQ & Wine Shuttle
item.description: Leave the busy city and enjoy a half-day experience filled with barbecue and wine by booking this Texas Hill Country Barbecue and Wine Shuttle Service from Austin. This shuttle service can be booked for small groups or private groups of up to 10 people. Your driver takes you to the outskirts of Austin to visit three different venues, including two popular wineries and Salt Lick BBQ outpost.

image.alt: From Austin: Hill Country BBQ & Wine Shuttle

item.title: Sightseeing Tour of Dallas
item.description: See the sights of Dallas on this small-group tour. Traveling with a guide who provides insider knowledge as you go, you'll check out attractions such as Pioneer Plaza, Dallas City Hall (designed by I.M. Pei), the Dallas Arts District, and Dealey Plaza, where JKF was shot. Plus, choose a morning or afternoon departure time to easily fit this tour into your schedule.

image.alt: Sightseeing Tour of Dallas

item.title: Haunted Austin Walking History Tour
item.description: Hear the historical tales of murder and mayhem that helped make Austin weird on this haunted history tour of Texas's capital city. Join an acclaimed storyteller and a small group for a walking tour through Austin's supernatural nooks and creepy crannies, including a tour of the famous Driskill Hotel.

image.alt: Haunted Austin Walking History Tour

item.title: The Haunted Ghost Bus Tour in San Antonio
item.description: See the haunted side of San Antonio on this ghost-themed bus tour. Your guide, a sinister fellow who proclaims to be in tune with the afterlife, leads you on a chilling exploration of the city’s famed haunted sites including the Menger Hotel, the old Red Light District, the former Bexar County Jail, an historic cemetery, and more.

image.alt: The Haunted Ghost Bus Tour in San Antonio

item.title: Austin Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours
item.description: Ideal for foodies and hungry visitors, this Downtown Austin Walking Food Tour lets you explore the city’s central and historic area and sample numerous foods—from barbecue brisket to Austin-style breakfast tacos and even an Italian cannoli. Along the way, discover some of the city’s popular sights and attractions as you stroll the streets with a guide who’s passionate about Austin and shares stories along the route.

image.alt: Austin Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours

item.title: Sunset River Cruise: #1 in the US
item.description: To soak up the beauty of Central Texas, nothing compares to a laid-back river cruise, with a guide to show you the sights. With this Waco pontoon boat tour on the Brazos River, let your guide lead the way as you see top sights around the city, and scenic landscapes all around. Along the way, hear about the Brazos from your guide, and learn what role this river has played in Waco's history.

image.alt: Sunset River Cruise: #1 in the US

item.title: Double Decker Austin Single Loop Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Save time looking up bus schedules and opt for this hassle-free Austin sightseeing bus tour instead. Travel on a loop around the city that passes by top landmarks in Austin’s downtown area. Along the way, listen to commentary from a guide, get great photos from the top deck, or sit in the climate-controlled lower deck. Highlights include 6th Street, The Museum of the Weird, The Driskill hotel, Texas State Capitol, and the Texas Governor’s Mansion.

image.alt: Double Decker Austin Single Loop Sightseeing Tour

item.title: Horseback Riding on Scenic Texas Ranch near Waco
item.description: Families and even couples can sometimes have a hard time finding activities everyone can enjoy. This Waco Horseback Riding Experience on a Texas Ranch is something everyone will love. You’ll ride horseback through the ranchlands with some authentic cowboys, while taking in beautiful views of the farmlands, the surrounding area, and the Brazos River.

image.alt: Horseback Riding on Scenic Texas Ranch near Waco

item.title: San Antonio Haunted History Ghost Tour
item.description: There's a lot of strange history that's happened here in the streets of San Antonio, and over the course of this San Antonio ghost tour, hear the haunted, paranormal tales of notorious Texas events. The tour begins and ends at The Alamo, where you meet your guides who are carrying lanterns and dressed in historic costumes. Walk the streets of the city's Old Town and learn its fascinating past, which is vividly and masterfully brought to life by the informative and passionate guides.

image.alt: San Antonio Haunted History Ghost Tour

item.title: Austin Electric Bike Tour: Let it Ride
item.description: If you want to see more of Austin in less time—without getting jammed into a tour bus—book this e-bike tour perfect for seeing the sights, while enjoying Austin's fantastic weather. Hop on your pedal-assist e-bike, and follow your guide to Austin's famous murals, city landmarks, and University of Texas buildings. Along the way, take in views of the downtown skyline, and visit the Texas State Capitol building.

image.alt: Austin Electric Bike Tour: Let it Ride

item.title: Parasailing Adventure in South Padre Island
item.description: A parasailing trip over South Padre Island is a popular choice for adventurous travelers. Once in the air, take in sweeping views of the island and surrounding natural landscape rarely seen by visitors or locals alike. Your guide ensures a smooth takeoff and landing, as well as tips on what wildlife you may be able to spot, from bottlenose dolphins to osprey hawks.

image.alt: Parasailing Adventure in South Padre Island

item.title: JFK Assassination Tour with Lee Harvey Oswald Rooming House
item.description: Immerse yourself in American history on a JFK–themed tour of Dallas, with stops at Dealey Plaza, President Kennedy’s memorial, and the location of Lee Harvey Oswald’s arrest. Your guide, who navigates for you, provides a history of JFK’s assassination and outlines the multitude of conspiracy theories that followed.

image.alt: JFK Assassination Tour with Lee Harvey Oswald Rooming House

item.title: Dallas and JFK Cruizer Tour
item.description: Opt for a more eco-friendly method of transport when sightseeing in Dallas and hop aboard an all-electric Cruizer. With just six passengers onboard, you'll have the undivided attention of your licensed guide as you zip through Downtown Dallas. See Pioneer Plaza, the Dallas Police Memorial, and John F. Kennedy Memorial Plaza along the way; admire views of Klyde Warren Park; and soak up the atmosphere in the Dallas Arts District.

image.alt: Dallas and JFK Cruizer Tour
